page.title: 13Liverpool Newsham,Religion
page.content: The practice of Christianity has waned in recent years and there is evidence of church closures and joining up of small congregations due to falling attendances. The majority of places of worship are C of E and Roman Catholic churches with some non_conformist ones. All these have services in the morning and evening. There is also a Christian Science meeting place, a Jehovah's Witness, a Mormon meeting place and a Salvation Army Hall. The area also has a synagogue and a Hindu Centre and Temple. Although the Hindu community is small the attendances at their temple are higher than for the Christian churches. Although interest in Christianity has waned there has been an increase in the use of churches for the community. Various groups meet in many of the churches.
